alert.note: Alert for Warren; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 4:12AM EST until December 19 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Edgecombe, Franklin, Halifax, Nash, Warren, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 AM EST, Although the heavy rain has ended, runoff and lingering high water from the widespread heavy rainfall of 2 to 4 inches received Sunday and Sunday night will continue to produce localized flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Contentnea Creek and Hominy Swamp in Wilson County and Stoney Creek in Wayne County, - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
